what: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: bSantiago data package results 2016 survey conducted Santiago, Chile, designed study health psychological status residents city respect daily commuting/travel experience. survey provides data examine feelings values respect active motorized modes transportation.

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: can install development version Santiago GitHub :

what: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: data package based paper-based survey conducted face--face Santiago 2016. goal Santiago contribute psychological impacts travelers examining feelings stress users active motorized modes transportation.Furthermore, also investigates importance travelers attach feelings stress.package contains different datasets namely Individual characteristics (IC), Health (H), Feelings emotions (FE), Reason planning decision (RPD), Social interaction (SI), Nature sustainability (NS), ITC shifting (), Build environment(), Traveling work (TW).

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: https://github.com/NiloofarNL/Santiago

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: Niloofar Nalaee, School Earth, Environment Society, McMaster University nalaeen@mcmaster.ca

title: A data frame with information about the build environment near the place of residence of respondents to the survey — Santiago_BE
text: @format data frame 451 rows 22 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r7AA_AUTOSPACE respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Space cars; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AB_PARKING_NUMB respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Amount parking spaces; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AC_QHIWAY respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Quality highways; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AD_PEDESTRN respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Space pedestrians; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AE_QSIDEWA respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Quality sidewalks; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AF_CLEAN_STOP respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Cleanliness bus stops; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AG_SEAT respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Sitting areas bus stops; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AH_CLIMA respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Weather protection bus stops; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AI_CICLEWA_NUMB respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Amount cycleways; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AJ_CICLEWA_Q respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Quality cycleways; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7AK_BICSHARE respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Bike sharing schemes; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r7BA_IMPAUTOSPACE respondents rate level importance : Space cars; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BB_IMPPARKING_NUMB respondents rate leve importance : Amount parking spaces; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BC_IMPQHIWAY respondents rate leve importance : Quality highways; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BD_IMPPEDESTRN respondents rate leve importance : Space pedestrians; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BE_IMPQSIDEWA respondents rate leve importance : Quality sidewalks; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BF_IMPCLEAN_STOP respondents rate leve importance : Cleanliness bus stops; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BG_IMPSEAT respondents rate leve importance : Sitting areas bus stops; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BH_IMPCLIMA respondents rate leve importance : Weather protection bus stops; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BI_IMPCICLEWA_NUMB respondents rate leve importance : Amount cycleways; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BJ_IMPCICLEWA_Q respondents rate leve importance : Quality cycleways; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r7BK_IMPBICSHARE respondents rate leve importance : Bike sharing schemes; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"

title: A data frame with information about the feelings and emotions of respondents to the survey — Santiago_FE
text: @format data frame 451 rows 22 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r2AA_FREEDOM indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Freedom; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AB_UNSAFETY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Unsafety; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AC_FUNCTIONALITY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Functionality; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AD_ENJOYMENT indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Enjoyment; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AE_LOWCOST indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Low cost; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AF_POVERTY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Poverty; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AG_SAFETY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Safety; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AH_WASTE_OF_TIME indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Waste time; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AI_UNPUNCTUALITY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Unpunctuality; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AJ_CONGEST indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Congestion; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AK_EFFICIENCY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Efficiency; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AL_LUXURY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Luxury; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AM_ENVIRONMENT indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Environmental care; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AN_HEALTH indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Health; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AO_INTSOCI indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Social Interaction; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AP_UNCOMFT indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Uncomfort; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AQ_HAPPINESS indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Happiness; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2AR_STATUS indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Status; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r2B_DAILY_ENJOY much respondents usually enjoy traveling daily activities?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VHIGH", "HIGH", "MEDIUM", "LOW", "VLOW" r2C_IMP_QUALITY level importance respondents attribute quality trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VHIGH", "HIGH", "MEDIUM", "LOW", "VLOW" r2D_AFFECT affect travel experience?; variable factor eight levels, "COMFORT ABSENCE", "SAFETY ABSENCE", "POOR QUALITY STREETS", "CROWDNESS PASSENGERS", "DISABILITY REDUCED MOBILITY", "TRAVEL TIME", "", "" r2E_FACILIT help respondents travel experience?; variable factor eight levels, "COMFORT IMPROVEMENT", "SAFETY IMPROVEMENT", "BETTER QULALITY STREETS", "LESS CROWDNESS PASSENGERS", "IMPROVEMENT ACCESIBILITY", "REDUCTION TIME TRAVEL", "", ""

title: A data frame with information about the health of respondents to the survey — Santiago_H

title: A data frame with information about the health of respondents to the survey — Santiago_H
text: @format data frame 451 rows 12 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r1A_STRESS respondents assess level stress experience usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VHIGH", "HIGH", "MEDIUM", "LOW", "VLOW" r1B_EFFORT respondents assess physical effort make travels?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VNEGATIVE", "NEGATIVE", "NEUTRAL", "POSITIVE", "VPOSITVE" r1C_PROX respondents assess level proximity (proximity) transport users usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r1D_CONTAM respondents assess level environmental pollution experience usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VDISSATISFIED", "DISSATISFIED", "UNSURE", "SATISFIED", "VSATTISFIED" r1E_SAFETY respondents assess level safety (assaulted harassed) experience usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VDISSATISFIED", "DISSATISFIED", "UNSURE", "SATISFIED", "VSATTISFIED" r1F_COMFORT respondents assess level comfort experience usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "VDISSATISFIED", "DISSATISFIED", "UNSURE", "SATISFIED", "VSATTISFIED" r1GA_IMPSTRESS importance respondents assign aspects? Levels stress; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r1GB_IMPEFFORT importance respondents assign aspects? Levels physical effort; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r1GC_IMPPROX importance respondents assign aspects? Levels proximity transport users; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r1GD_IMPCONTAM importance respondents assign aspects? Levels (perceived) air pollution; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r1GE_IMPSAFETY importance respondents assign aspects? Levels safety; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r1GF_IMPCOMFORT importance respondents assign aspects? Levels comfort; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"

title: A data frame with information about the health of respondents to the survey — Santiago_H

title: A data frame with socio-demographic information of respondents to the survey — Santiago_IC
A data frame with socio-demographic information of respondents to the survey — Santiago_IC
text: data frame 451 rows 22 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r0A_COMMUNE Commune residence r0B_MACR_ZONE Macro area residence r0B_STREET_1 Intersections close home r0B_STREET_2 Intersections close home r0C_SEX Sex respondents Santiago 2016; variable factor two levels, "FEMALE" "MALE" r0D_AGE Age respondents Santiago 2016; variable ordered factor Six levels, "Less18", "18to24", "25to34", "35to54", "55to64", "65more" r0E_WEIGHT Weight respondents kg r0F_HEIGHT Height respondents cm r0G_EDUCATION Level education respondents Santiago 2016; variable ordered factor five levels, "ELEMENTARY", "SECUNDARY", "PROFESS_TECH", "COLLEGE", "POSTGRAD" r0H_OCCUPATION Occupation respondents Santiago 2016; variable factor nine levels, "FULL_TIME", "PART_TIME", "SELF_EMPLOYED", "UNEMPLOYED", "HOME_TAKER", "STUDENT", "STUDENT_WORK", "RETIRED", "" r0I_WORK_COM_1 Commune perform work/studies/regular trips r0I_WORK_COM_2 Commune perform second set work/studies/regular trips r0J_INCOME Level income respondents Santiago 2016; variable ordered factor six levels, "Less423", "423to639", "639to977", "977to1550", "1550to2380", "2380more" levels pesos r0K_ADULTS Number adults living home r0L_CHILDREN Number children iving home r0N_DRIVING_LICENSE driving licence; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" r0M_DISABILITY disable ; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" r0O_TYPE_DIS Type disability r0P_MODE1 Main transport mode used respondents Santiago 2016; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r0Q_MODE2 Secondary transport mode used respondents Santiago 2016; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r0R_MODE3 transport mode add used respondents Santiago 2016; variable factor eight levels,"CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK"

title: A data frame with information about the telecommunication and shifting different modes of travel by respondents to the survey — Santiago_IS
text: @format data frame 451 rows 9 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r6A_SHIFT respondents shift transport modes usual trips?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" r6B_QUALITY_SHIFT YES previous question, quality interchanges?; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r6CA_WAITING respondents assess regular trips terms : Waiting times; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r6CB_TIME_SHIFT respondents assess regular trips terms : Time shifts; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r6CC_TOTALTIME respondents assess regular trips terms : Travel time; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r6D_DIFFICULTY main aspect makes shifts difficult?; variable factor six levels, "Bad physical conection sidewalks", "long shifts", "Uncomfortable shifting", "Bad infrastructure waiting times", "Unsafe shifting ", "previous ones","" r6E_TOOL respondents access technology tools smartphones internet, can view information transportation services?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" r6F_INFO assess level technological information available see transportation alternatives? (eg smartphone applications, internet, signs); variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r6G_IMP_INFO important respondents access technological information usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"

title: A data frame with information about the nature and sustainability from the viewpoint of respondents to the survey — Santiago_NS
text: @format data frame 451 rows 10 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r5A_CHANGE climatic event like heavy rain flood, respondents change main mode transport?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" r5B_CHANGE_MODE respondents answered yes (change mode transport weather event), indication mode(s) required; variable factor eight levels, "CAR", "TAXI", "COLECTIVO", "MOTO", "METRO", "BUS","BICYCLE", "WALK" r5C_SUST respondents assess access currently available sustainable modes transport? (eg hybrid buses, electric cars, public bicycles); variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r5D_IMP_SUST important respondents access sustainable modes transport?; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r5E_PAYMENT respondents willing spend transportation gain access sustainable modes?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" r5F_PAYMENTS respondents' previous response positive, indication much transportation expense increase; variable ordered factor three levels, "5-15%", "15-30%", "30% " r5GA_TREE indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Presence trees; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r5GB_PARK indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Access parks; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r5GC_MODE indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Access sustainable transport modes; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" r5GD_MODE indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Broaden supply sustainable transport modes; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"

title: A data frame with information about the nature and sustainability from the viewpoint of respondents to the survey — Santiago_NS

title: A data frame with information about traveling to work by respondents to the survey — Santiago_TW
text: @format data frame 451 rows 7 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent r8A_ACCESSJOB much respondents think access transport network affected chances better job?; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPACT", "MINOR IMPACT", "IMPACT", "MODERATE IMPACT", "MAJOR IMPACT" r8B_JOBOPP respondents assess job opportunities available commune residence?; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r8C_ACC_COM level access employment respondents interested commune residence?; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" r8D_EMPLSATISF satisfied respondents current job?; variable ordered factor five levels, "SATISFIED", "LOW SATISFIED", "MEDIUM SATISFIED", "HIGH SATIAFIED", "VHIGH SATISFIED" r8E_TIMECOMMUT long regular commuting?; variable ordered factor four levels, "0-20 min", "20-40 min", "40-60 min", "1h " r8F_SCHEDULE frequent time commuting?; variable ordered factor six levels, "7:00 - 9:00", "9:00 - 13:00", "13:00 - 15:00", "15:00 - 18:00", "18:00 - 21:00", "Others" r8G_SPENDING Monthly expenditure transport; variable ordered factor four levels, "Less 35.000", "35.000-75.000", "75.000-125.000", "125.000"

title: A data frame with information about traveling to work by respondents to the survey — Santiago_TW
